post_text: I hope school is going well today for everyone. For anyone who doesn't have Wifi, I have increased the power on the Wifi at school and you should be able to get a signal in the parking lot from your car if you need to. Good luck.

post_text: Following the advice of local health officials, MG School has decided to extend Spring Break by one week. As of now we plan to return to school on Monday, March 23. All school activities are cancelled until then. For more information the full press release will be added to our website mgisd.net later tonight. It is recommended that you restrict your social activities this week so it sounds like a good week to read some books and maybe brush up on your math skills!
shared_text:
MGISD.NET
Miller Grove ISD – Home of the hornets
text:
Following the advice of local health officials, MG School has decided to extend Spring Break by one week. As of now we plan to return to school on Monday, March 23. All school activities are cancelled until then. For more information the full press release will be added to our website mgisd.net later tonight. It is recommended that you restrict your social activities this week so it sounds like a good week to read some books and maybe brush up on your math skills!

MGISD.NET
Miller Grove ISD – Home of the hornets

post_text: Our Miller Grove robotics teams did great tonight at the Terrell competition. We placed 9th and 15th. Three more competitions in this meet. Can’t wait to see what they do.
text: Our Miller Grove robotics teams did great tonight at the Terrell competition. We placed 9th and 15th. Three more competitions in this meet. Can’t wait to see what they do.

shared_text:
Miller Grove ISD Robotics is feeling motivated.
December 4, 2019 at 9:49 AM ·

Super proud of both of our Robotics teams! They competed in Greenville yesterday and Alessandro's team's robot scored first place in the qualifiers! George and Hannah's robot came in 18th! We are new to the Vex Robotics Competition this year and working very hard and having a lot of fun. We have another competition next week on the 12th in Terrell. Thanks to our sponsors InTouch by Cumbytel, Alliance Bank and Jay Hodge Chevrolet for their support. Pictured here with team 580x.
text:

December 4, 2019 at 9:49 AM ·

Super proud of both of our Robotics teams! They competed in Greenville yesterday and Alessandro's team's robot scored first place in the qualifiers! George and Hannah's robot came in 18th! We are new to the Vex Robotics Competition this year and working very hard and having a lot of fun. We have another competition next week on the 12th in Terrell. Thanks to our sponsors InTouch by Cumbytel, Alliance Bank and Jay Hodge Chevrolet for their support. Pictured here with team 580x.

mySSnews.com
December 1, 2019 at 6:23 PM ·

Miller Grove volunteer fire department welcomed their newest addition just in time for Christmas-- a 5-ton truck that will be renamed 'Boomer 13.' The FFA helped outfit the truck and everyone is proud of their hard work. Read more in Saturday's print edition or online at: https://www.ssnewstelegram.com/news/miller-groves-new-truck-ready-action

post_text:
BELIEVE...TRUST...DO

Miller Grove WON State! XC CHAMPIONS:)

Jorja Bessonett WON state!
The girls team WON state!
Isaiah Billingsley WON state!
The boys team WON state!

Kobe Robertson was second!

Way to go Miller Grove:)

There was never a perfect spot to make the perfect picture!! ...There was too much emotion and then thinking of taking a picture on that particular moment! ...But here some of the pictures that we made yesterday in the XC meet where our coaches and students made us feel so proud!

post_text: There will be a parent meeting Thursday Night November 15th at 5:30 p.m. in the high school library for all students and parents who are currently taking college & dual credit courses. This meeting will be an informative meeting to make parents aware of the requirements, procedures, courses offered, how these courses affect their high school transcript, upcoming spring registration and various other important topics. This will be a very informative meeting that you do not want to miss and a great opportunity to ask any questions that you have.

post_text: Parents, STAAR test results for grades 308 are now available. Please go to www.texasassessment.com to check scores. To access the Parent Portal, log in with your child's access code and birth date. If you do not know your child's access code, click the Find My Access Code button. You will need to look up each child individually with their unique access code and birth date combination.

post_text: The school trip to Splash Kingdom in Greenville is tomorrow. If you haven't returned a signed permission slip and money, please bring it in the morning. PTO is providing lunch, but if students want to buy snacks, drinks, etc. please send spending money. Lunch will be 2 pieces of pizza and a drink. Parents or extra family members will be $12 at the gate. Please send a towel and change of clothes and sunscreen. Coolers, water toys and outside food and drink will not be allowed in the park. Remind students to be safe, respectful and to behave in the water park. Notes have been sent home with more information.
text: The school trip to Splash Kingdom in Greenville is tomorrow. If you haven't returned a signed permission slip and money, please bring it in the morning. PTO is providing lunch, but if students want to buy snacks, drinks, etc. please send spending money. Lunch will be 2 pieces of pizza and a drink. Parents or extra family members will be $12 at the gate. Please send a towel and change of clothes and sunscreen. Coolers, water toys and outside food and drink will not be allowed in the park. Remind students to be safe, respectful and to behave in the water park. Notes have been sent home with more information.

post_text: There is a virus spreading right now through email with a link to open a Google Doc. Don't open the link.. Even if it comes from someone you know at school or another school. It does not appear to do anything bad other than email itself to your contacts.

post_text: The 2017 Daddy-Daughter Dance is Saturday, February 11. Notes have been sent home. The cost is $25 for the first Daddy/Daughter couple and then $10 for each additional girl. post_text: The Miller Grove Christmas Concert is this Thursday, December 8th, at 6 pm in the high school library. Mrs. Bryant’s high school choir class and Mrs. Gress's 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th grade art students will perform Christmas songs. 1st-5th grade students need to arrive no later that 5:45 pm and should try to dress in Christmas attire or at least wear the colors red and/or green.

King and Queen, class raffle drawings, pumpkin contest prizes and student cash prize drawing will all be at 7:45. Bingo will run from 8-10.

Tomorrow, Friday, is the End of Year Stew at lunch time and the FFA Awards Banquet will start at 6 pm, Friday evening, in the new gym with award presentations beginning at 7 pm. post_text: Please note: Car rider drop off and pick up will change for the remainder of the year. Please drop your children off in the mornings in front of the old gym where the buses parked previously. Afternoon pick up has been moved to that parking lot as well. You will enter near the ag shop and form two lines then exit by the playground. People will be out directing traffic the first few days. Thank you.

post_text: The MGISD Back to School Bash will be Thursday night from 5:30 to 7:30. Classrooms will be open from 5:30-6:30. There will be free BBQ in the cafeteria starting at 6, provided by PTO, and a PTO meeting at 6:30 in the school cafeteria. There will be a meeting with parents of ESL students in the cafeteria at 7:00. School starts Monday morning at 8 am.

There will be a meeting with parents of ESL students in the cafeteria at 7:00. School starts Monday morning at 8 am.

post_text: Tomorrow is Elementary Field Day. Students need to wear tennis shoes as some activities will require running and we don't want anyone getting hurt. Please no flip flops. Boys may wear swim trunks and a t-shirt. Girls may wear a swim suit under their clothes. Don't forget to bring a towel and please apply sunscreen before school. We will have sunscreen on hand as well. Also, Kona Ice will be here so don't forget to send snow cone money! You can pack a sack lunch, or the cafeteria will have sack lunches available.

FFA will be having a rodeo in the old gym for pk-1st grade from 6:30-7:30. We will also be hosting Dollar Hot Dog Night on the playground for everyone so come hungry.
text: Thursday, May 21 is the Miller Grove Elementary open house. Classrooms will open at 5:30. PK - 1st grade will stay open until 6:30 and 2nd - 5th will stay open until 7:00. FFA will be having a rodeo in the old gym for pk-1st grade from 6:30-7:30. We will also be hosting Dollar Hot Dog Night on the playground for everyone so come hungry.

post_text: Don't forget! The FFA banquet will be tomorrow night, Tuesday, May 19, starting at 6:30 with awards at 7:15.
text: Don't forget! The FFA banquet will be tomorrow night, Tuesday, May 19, starting at 6:30 with awards at 7:15.

post_text: As of May 15th, the school cafeteria will not be able to charge meals for accounts that are delinquent. Letters have been sent home with students who have a negative balance in their school account with the cafeteria. Again, all charges must be paid in full by May 15th. If you are not sure if your child's account is in good standing, please call the school.

post_text: 2015 Prom DVDs are now available for purchase! The cost is $25 which includes: DVD with over 500 photos of prom (including formals), a slideshow, and your choice of one 8x10 print OR two 5x7 prints of the formal photo. Order forms are available in the high school office.

post_text: Spring Pictures have been sent home with Miller Grove students. These pictures are not free. Please read the instructions in the envelope on how to purchase any of the pictures. If you are not going to purchase anything, please return all of the pictures to the high school office. If you are going to purchase something, then keep what you want to purchase and please return only what you are not going to purchase.

post_text: Parents, grades 3 thru 8 will be taking STAAR tests on Tuesday and Wednesday. It is important for students to get a good night's rest and to have a good breakfast for these testing days.

post_text: The final dress rehearsal of the dance which our 8th-11th Spanish class students will perform at the NET-OLE UIL competition at A&M Commerce is this coming Friday, April 17th. They have also been making crafts which will be on display. This final dress rehearsal will be performed immediately after school Thursday, April 16 in the new gym.

post_text: Tuesday, April 14th is Spring picture day. Please remind students to dress nice for picture day and to bring their money envelopes for the photographer. Envelopes have been sent home, but there are more in the office if you didn't get one. We will be taking class pictures and Spring portraits, as well as Kindergarten graduation pictures.
